questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST effective for communicating forward-looking trends within security reporting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Key risk indicators (KRIs) are most effective for communicating forward-looking trends within security reporting. KRIs are metrics that measure potential risks and help organizations to anticipate and respond to future security threats. They provide early warning signals that help organizations take proactive measures to prevent or mitigate risks.

A. Key risk indicators (KRI) focus on forward-looking trends in security reporting, they are indicators that focus on predictive or leading factors. KPIs on the other hand are retrospective in nature, meaning they provide insights into how well an organization has performed in the past or is currently performing. They often measure outcomes based on historical data. So since the question is forward looking, the correct answer is definitely A. Key risk indicators (KRIs).
The MOST effective for communicating forward-looking trends within security reporting are Key Risk Indicators (KRIs).

An organization recently purchased data loss prevention (DLP) software but soon discovered the software fails to detect or prevent data loss.

Which of the following should the information security manager do FIRST?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Why on earth people choose A? You should not change your security requirements right away, if you cannot implement the related measure efficiently. Instead, it would be wise to first look for the cause (e.g., why the DLP software is not working)? If nothing helps and you cannot implement measures as requirements state, then you might want to consider changing requirements (e.g., maybe requirements were wrongly set / identified). Option C is the right one for me.
